page.title: 06Farming in the Yaxham Area
page.content: The farming activity of this area is truly 'mixed'. Although there are a number of farms which have an equal balance of stock breeding, rearing and arable crops, most tend to specialize to some degree. At the present there is considerable acreage devoted to cereals, sugar beet and oil seed rape, but potatoes and smaller amounts of strawberries and sweet corn can be found. There is a large Dairy herd of Freisian Cattle in Yaxham as well as three farms with considerable pig units involved in breeding and fattening. Although many hedges have been removed to increase acreage and save work, and many elm trees have been killed by the elm bark beetle the area has been spared the bleak 'prairie' look by the retention of some coverts and hedges.
